intro: Prasium melissifolium, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It features aromatic, opposite leaves that are often described as having a lemony scent due to the presence of volatile oils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are widely used in herbal medicine for their calming properties and are also popular in culinary applications. Prasium melissifolium thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
